qas.question: What divided Asia on a similar basis?
"Scythia this side of the Himalayas" is located where?
"India on this side of the Ganges" is located where?
"Scythia beyond the Himalayas" is located where?

context: <a0_0>Ptolemy's Geography<a0_0/> divided Asia on a similar basis. <a1_0><a3_0>In the north<a3_0/><a1_0/> is "Scythia this side of the Himalayas" and "Scythia beyond the Himalayas." <a2_0>To the south<a2_0/> is "India on this side of the Ganges" and "India beyond the Ganges." Asia began <a4_0>on the coast of Anatolia<a4_0/> ("land of the rising sun"). Beyond the Ganges and Himalayas (including the Tien Shan) were Serica and Serae (sections of China) and some other identifiable far eastern locations known to the voyagers and geographers but not to the general European public.
